name.en: Principle and Use of Powder XRD in Chemistry
name.ch: 粉末X-光繞射的原理與在化學上的應用

goal.ch: “This course is addressed to teach student how to use Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) to identify the phase composition, possible impurities, as well as crystallite sizes and crystal defects in their synthesized compounds. It is aimed to give a good understanding of the basics of diffraction on powder-like materials.“
goal.en: “This course is addressed to teach student how to use Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) to identify the phase composition, possible impurities, as well as crystallite sizes and crystal defects in their synthesized compounds. It is aimed to give a good understanding of the basics of diffraction on powder-like materials.“

outline.ch:
“1.) Brief history of X-ray invention and invention of X-ray diffraction (XRD)
2.) Instrumentation: X-ray sources: X-ray diffractometers for powder XRD (PXRD); X-ray detectors
3.) Basics of elastic scattering of X-rays on matter
4.) Fourier Transform as a covenient mathematical tool for understanding diffraction effects
5.) Bragg equation and indexing of X-ray powder patterns
6.) Structure factors: calculation of the Bragg peak intensities of simple cubic lattices (FCC, BCC); multiplicity factor of a powder diffraction
7.) Line profile analysis of PXRD: determination of crystallite size and crystal defects
8.) Concept of reciprocal lattice and the Ewald construction; Application to 2-dimensional lattices
9.) Determination of impurities and quantitative phase analysis in multi-component systems“
